intro: Tephrosia hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale yellow. Its seed pods are typically elongated and contain several seeds. Tephrosia hookeriana is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
